snippet.textDisplay: Compared to what Rockstar Games has put out, this is a step forward in a story telling light. If you want a game to steal cars and raise havoc like their other games (apart from Red Dead) utilizing the same format of game play; try the games they made for just that. Or Saints Row the Third.
snippet.textOriginal: Compared to what Rockstar Games has put out, this is a step forward in a story telling light. If you want a game to steal cars and raise havoc like their other games (apart from Red Dead) utilizing the same format of game play; try the games they made for just that. Or Saints Row the Third.

snippet.textDisplay:
If you're focused on hype surrounding a game and not the content itself, I wouldn't call you a gamer, I'd call you a gimmick.  You're a contributor to the hype which can, and has, destroyed otherwise substantial games.

My example would have to be Dead Island; every game store I went to was trying to get me to pre-order this game and kept trying to hype up the "You're killing zombies" element of the game.  I picked this game up last week for $16, turns out it has a great online co-op campaign.
snippet.textOriginal:
If you're focused on hype surrounding a game and not the content itself, I wouldn't call you a gamer, I'd call you a gimmick.  You're a contributor to the hype which can, and has, destroyed otherwise substantial games.

My example would have to be Dead Island; every game store I went to was trying to get me to pre-order this game and kept trying to hype up the "You're killing zombies" element of the game.  I picked this game up last week for $16, turns out it has a great online co-op campaign.

snippet.textDisplay: It was a very good game. How did it not live up to the hype it created? And if it was over-hyped to you, that is the marketing division's fault. The developers themselves crafted an excellent game.
snippet.textOriginal: It was a very good game. How did it not live up to the hype it created? And if it was over-hyped to you, that is the marketing division's fault. The developers themselves crafted an excellent game.

snippet.textDisplay: The point of the game is the story, not the gameplay. Does every mistake you make have to impact the overarching plot? No. Personally, I can't understand why people don't like it.
snippet.textOriginal: The point of the game is the story, not the gameplay. Does every mistake you make have to impact the overarching plot? No. Personally, I can't understand why people don't like it.

snippet.textDisplay: I would highly recommend it. Personally, I would give it a 9.5/10.

snippet.textDisplay: I approached this game in the same manner as I approached Heavy Rain.  It has great intentions and executed interrogation quite well.  Personally, I found the story fascinating.  I hope we can see at least one more game like this in the future.
snippet.textOriginal: I approached this game in the same manner as I approached Heavy Rain.  It has great intentions and executed interrogation quite well.  Personally, I found the story fascinating.  I hope we can see at least one more game like this in the future.

snippet.textDisplay: This is one of the prime examples of why games of the "Generation Autosave" are always  underwhelming to me. You can fuck up every single case in the game and you will still have the same story progression as intended. Come on, what's so bad in starting over sometimes? Also the gameplay is really dull, there is crime-scene, driving, sneaking, chase and investigation. Once you've seen them all, the game keeps using them again and again. The huge amount of boring side-missions doesn't help either
snippet.textOriginal: This is one of the prime examples of why games of the "Generation Autosave" are always  underwhelming to me. You can fuck up every single case in the game and you will still have the same story progression as intended. Come on, what's so bad in starting over sometimes? Also the gameplay is really dull, there is crime-scene, driving, sneaking, chase and investigation. Once you've seen them all, the game keeps using them again and again. The huge amount of boring side-missions doesn't help either

snippet.textDisplay: I absolutely love this game. It isn't for everyone, but it was certainly for me. I can't promise you'd like it, but its worth giving a shot. I love the way cases and interrogations are handled, the story is great, sandbox element works really well. Other than some minor graphical flaws, this has quickly become one of my favorite games.
snippet.textOriginal: I absolutely love this game. It isn't for everyone, but it was certainly for me. I can't promise you'd like it, but its worth giving a shot. I love the way cases and interrogations are handled, the story is great, sandbox element works really well. Other than some minor graphical flaws, this has quickly become one of my favorite games.

snippet.textDisplay: This and Arkham City were my favorite games from last year. I don't understand how anyone could not like it.

snippet.textDisplay: There was a lot of good music in this game. It did a perfect job setting the scene for this game. Really good use of dynamics too.
snippet.textOriginal: There was a lot of good music in this game. It did a perfect job setting the scene for this game. Really good use of dynamics too.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm playing through the game right now for the first time and I've gotta say - it has great story, outstanding voice and face acting (if you can call it like that), and overwhelming atmosphere of time and space. However, there are some flaws of the enviroment, colliding graphic models and so on, that kinda spoil the fun. But if you overlook this and concentrate on the story... That's one hell of a game.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm playing through the game right now for the first time and I've gotta say - it has great story, outstanding voice and face acting (if you can call it like that), and overwhelming atmosphere of time and space. However, there are some flaws of the enviroment, colliding graphic models and so on, that kinda spoil the fun. But if you overlook this and concentrate on the story... That's one hell of a game.

snippet.textDisplay: I don't know if I'll ever have time to play this game but it certainly looks interesting. I've heard mixed feelings about it. The way the investigations are handled looks pretty unique. This kind of music is exactly what I'd expect to hear from this kind of game and style.
